intro: Reseda armena var. scabridula, commonly known as Armenian Reseda, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or pale yellow, appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. This variety is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
